intro: Stisseria orbicularis, commonly known as the roundleaf stisseria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its orbicular (round) leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Stisseria orbicularis is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
